slides.title: Your Brain: The Command Center
slides.narration: Your brain is the ultimate command center. This three-pound powerhouse controls everything you think, feel, and do, using a complex and rapid mix of electricity and chemicals to run the show.

slides.title: Neurons: Electric Messengers
slides.narration: The brain's work is done by billions of neurons. These are tiny, specialized cells that act like wires, firing electrical signals to communicate with each other almost instantly across vast networks.

slides.title: Brain Zones: Key Regions
slides.narration: The brain has specialized zones. The large cerebrum handles complex thought, the cerebellum at the back controls balance, and the brainstem manages automatic survival functions like your heartbeat and breathing.

slides.title: Synapses: The Spark Gap
points: Allows signals to jump from cell to cell
slides.narration: So how do neurons talk? At a microscopic gap called a synapse. An electrical signal triggers the release of chemicals that jump across this gap, carrying the message to the next neuron.

slides.title: Neuroplasticity: A Changing Mind
slides.narration: Amazingly, your brain isn't static. It’s constantly changing through a process called neuroplasticity. Every time you learn something new or practice a skill, you are physically rewiring your brain.

slides.title: Protect Your Powerhouse
slides.narration: This incredible organ needs care. Getting enough sleep, eating well, and challenging yourself with new activities helps keep your brain healthy, sharp, and ready for anything. So protect your powerhouse.
